title: Quiz 7: Blood Pressure, Heart & ECG
topicName: Essential Knowledge and Skills for Healthcare Assistants
description: Assess knowledge of the cardiovascular system, blood pressure technique, and ECGs.

questions.question: The ___BLANK___ pressure is the force when the heart contracts (the higher number), and the ___BLANK___ pressure is the force when the heart relaxes (the lower number).
questions.hint: S comes before D in the reading.

questions.question: Which of the following Korotkoff sounds denotes the Diastolic pressure?
questions.explanation: Phase 5 (disappearance of sound) is the standard diastolic reading.

questions.question: Order the flow of blood through the heart:
questions.explanation: Deoxygenated blood enters Right side, goes to lungs, returns Oxygenated to Left side, pumped to body.
questions.hint: Right side first, then lungs, then Left.

questions.question: Match the ECG Lead with its correct position:

pairs.right: Mid-axillary line, same level as V4

questions.hint: V1 is right, V2 is left, V4 is mid-clavicle.

questions.question: Which of the following factors can increase resistance in arteries and raise blood pressure? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Narrowing, stiffness, and high volume increase pressure. Relaxation lowers it.
questions.hint: Think of water in a hosepipe.

questions.question: What is the mnemonic for remembering limb lead colours (Red, Yellow, Green, Black)?
questions.explanation: Ride Your Green Bike (Right arm, Left arm, Left leg, Right leg - though black is usually Right leg).

questions.question: A diagnosis of hypertension can be made based on a single high reading in the surgery.
questions.explanation: Diagnosis requires multiple readings over time, often using Ambulatory (24hr) or Home monitoring to rule out 'White Coat Hypertension'.
questions.hint: Can anxiety cause a one-off high reading?

questions.question: In the PQRST complex of an ECG, what does the QRS complex represent?
questions.explanation: P is Atrial contraction. QRS is Ventricular contraction (the big spike). T is repolarization.

questions.question: What is 'White Coat Hypertension'?

options.text: High BP caused by wearing tight coats
High BP only when in a clinical setting due to anxiety

questions.explanation: It refers to BP that is high in a clinic but normal at home.

questions.question: If a patient has a tremor or is an amputee, where might you have to place the limb electrodes?
questions.explanation: Electrodes can be moved proximally (closer to the body) to the shoulders or lower torso if limbs are unavailable or moving.
